He immigrated from Indonesia 3 years ago to join his family in the United States. His temperature is 38.7°C (101.7°F) and blood pressure is 122/84 mm Hg. Physical exam shows a well-defined hypopigmented skin lesion approximately 3 cm in diameter over the anterior aspect of the right knee. The area has no hair growth and remains dry although he is diaphoretic. There is diminished sensation to light touch and pinprick in the skin lesion when compared to surrounding skin. There is reduced light touch sensation in the big toes bilaterally.
